comprehensive_overview: util-linux-uuid is a command-line utility that allows users to generate universally unique identifiers (UUIDs) in various formats. UUIDs are 128-bit numbers used as identifiers for entities in computer systems with a high probability of being unique.
core_features:
1. Generation of UUIDs in different formats (time-based, random-based, name-based, and more).
2. Flexible output options for customizing the UUID format.
3. Efficient and lightweight command-line tool for generating unique identifiers.
4. Support for both standard UUID versions (including UUIDv1 and UUIDv4) and non-standard variants.
